intro: Thamnochortus karooica, commonly known as the Karoo groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flower heads that are typically clustered in dense, spherical formations. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open grasslands. Thamnochortus karooica is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
